attributes.action: Put a climate damage score on all foods so consumers can make informed decisions
attributes.additional_details: This is something that individuals can’t do on their own as there is so much we don’t know about our food. For example, one avocado may come from a well established tree, whereas another may come from a source that has had to cut down trees to plant a new avocado tree and so would be a worse choice for the environment. Even if all fossil fuels were stopped tomorrow, the planet will still heat up by 2 degrees by the end of the century if we don’t change how we eat.
attributes.background: A third of all climate damage is caused by what we eat whether through deforestation, air miles, or methane emissions. By putting scores on food (like nutritional information) consumers can make a big difference to their carbon footprint by choosing lower scored foods

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see new labelling requirements for food, but it's not clear how you want "climate damage scores" to be calculated.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
